reasoning: Invasive ductal carcinoma (IDC) accounts for ~70-80% of breast cancers. Global breast cancer incidence 2005 was ~50 per 100k women (GLOBOCAN), translating to ~25 per 100k overall population. IDC represents ~72% of cases, yielding ~18 per 100k.
source: Parkin DM et al. (2005). Global cancer statistics, 2002. CA Cancer J Clin. 55(2):74-108
